speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: SCENE I. London. The Parliament-house.

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, EXETER, GLOUCESTER,  WARWICK, SOMERSET, and SUFFOLK; the BISHOP OF  WINCHESTER, RICHARD PLANTAGENET, and others.  GLOUCESTER offers to put up a bill; BISHOP OF WINCHESTER snatches it, and tears it

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Comest thou with deep premeditated lines,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: With written pamphlets studiously devised,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Humphrey of Gloucester? If thou canst accuse,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Or aught intend'st to lay unto my charge,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Do it without invention, suddenly;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: As I with sudden and extemporal speech

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Purpose to answer what thou canst object.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Presumptuous priest! this place commands my patience,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or thou shouldst find thou hast dishonour'd me.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Think not, although in writing I preferr'd

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The manner of thy vile outrageous crimes,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That therefore I have forged, or am not able

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Verbatim to rehearse the method of my pen:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No, prelate; such is thy audacious wickedness,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thy lewd, pestiferous and dissentious pranks,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As very infants prattle of thy pride.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou art a most pernicious usurer,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Forward by nature, enemy to peace;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Lascivious, wanton, more than well beseems

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A man of thy profession and degree;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And for thy treachery, what's more manifest?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In that thou laid'st a trap to take my life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As well at London bridge as at the Tower.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Beside, I fear me, if thy thoughts were sifted,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The king, thy sovereign, is not quite exempt

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: From envious malice of thy swelling heart.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Gloucester, I do defy thee. Lords, vouchsafe

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: To give me hearing what I shall reply.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: If I were covetous, ambitious or perverse,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: As he will have me, how am I so poor?

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Or how haps it I seek not to advance

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Or raise myself, but keep my wonted calling?

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And for dissension, who preferreth peace

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: More than I do?--except I be provoked.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: No, my good lords, it is not that offends;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: It is not that that hath incensed the duke:

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: It is, because no one should sway but he;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: No one but he should be about the king;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And that engenders thunder in his breast

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And makes him roar these accusations forth.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: But he shall know I am as good--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As good!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou bastard of my grandfather!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Ay, lordly sir; for what are you, I pray,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: But one imperious in another's throne?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Am I not protector, saucy priest?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And am not I a prelate of the church?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Yes, as an outlaw in a castle keeps

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And useth it to patronage his theft.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Unreverent Gloster!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou art reverent

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Touching thy spiritual function, not thy life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Rome shall remedy this.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Roam thither, then.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: My lord, it were your duty to forbear.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Ay, see the bishop be not overborne.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Methinks my lord should be religious

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And know the office that belongs to such.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Methinks his lordship should be humbler;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: it fitteth not a prelate so to plead.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Yes, when his holy state is touch'd so near.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: State holy or unhallow'd, what of that?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Is not his grace protector to the king?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: RICHARD

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: [Aside]  Plantagenet, I see, must hold his tongue,

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: Lest it be said 'Speak, sirrah, when you should;

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: Must your bold verdict enter talk with lords?'

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: Else would I have a fling at Winchester.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Uncles of Gloucester and of Winchester,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The special watchmen of our English weal,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I would prevail, if prayers might prevail,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To join your hearts in love and amity.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O, what a scandal is it to our crown,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That two such noble peers as ye should jar!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Believe me, lords, my tender years can tell

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Civil dissension is a viperous worm

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That gnaws the bowels of the commonwealth.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: A noise within, 'Down with the tawny-coats!'

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What tumult's this?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: An uproar, I dare warrant,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Begun through malice of the bishop's men.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: A noise again, 'Stones! stones!' Enter Mayor

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: O, my good lords, and virtuous Henry,

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Pity the city of London, pity us!

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: The bishop and the Duke of Gloucester's men,

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Forbidden late to carry any weapon,

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Have fill'd their pockets full of pebble stones

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: And banding themselves in contrary parts

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Do pelt so fast at one another's pate

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: That many have their giddy brains knock'd out:

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Our windows are broke down in every street

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: And we for fear compell'd to shut our shops.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Enter Serving-men, in skirmish, with bloody pates

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: We charge you, on allegiance to ourself,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To hold your slaughtering hands and keep the peace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Pray, uncle Gloucester, mitigate this strife.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: First Serving-man Nay, if we be forbidden stones,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: We'll fall to it with our teeth.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Second Serving-man Do what ye dare, we are as resolute.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Skirmish again

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You of my household, leave this peevish broil

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And set this unaccustom'd fight aside.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Third Serving-man My lord, we know your grace to be a man

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Just and upright; and, for your royal birth,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Inferior to none but to his majesty:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And ere that we will suffer such a prince,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So kind a father of the commonweal,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To be disgraced by an inkhorn mate,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: We and our wives and children all will fight

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And have our bodies slaughtered by thy foes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: First Serving-man Ay, and the very parings of our nails

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shall pitch a field when we are dead.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Begin again

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stay, stay, I say!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And if you love me, as you say you do,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let me persuade you to forbear awhile.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O, how this discord doth afflict my soul!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Can you, my Lord of Winchester, behold

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My sighs and tears and will not once relent?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Who should be pitiful, if you be not?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Or who should study to prefer a peace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If holy churchmen take delight in broils?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Yield, my lord protector; yield, Winchester;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Except you mean with obstinate repulse

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: To slay your sovereign and destroy the realm.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: You see what mischief and what murder too

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Hath been enacted through your enmity;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Then be at peace except ye thirst for blood.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: He shall submit, or I will never yield.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Compassion on the king commands me stoop;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or I would see his heart out, ere the priest

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Should ever get that privilege of me.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Behold, my Lord of Winchester, the duke

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Hath banish'd moody discontented fury,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: As by his smoothed brows it doth appear:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Why look you still so stern and tragical?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here, Winchester, I offer thee my hand.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Fie, uncle Beaufort! I have heard you preach

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That malice was a great and grievous sin;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And will not you maintain the thing you teach,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But prove a chief offender in the same?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Sweet king! the bishop hath a kindly gird.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For shame, my lord of Winchester, relent!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: What, shall a child instruct you what to do?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Well, Duke of Gloucester, I will yield to thee;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Love for thy love and hand for hand I give.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Aside]  Ay, but, I fear me, with a hollow heart.--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: See here, my friends and loving countrymen,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This token serveth for a flag of truce

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Betwixt ourselves and all our followers:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So help me God, as I dissemble not!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: [Aside]  So help me God, as I intend it not!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O, loving uncle, kind Duke of Gloucester,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: How joyful am I made by this contract!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Away, my masters! trouble us no more;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But join in friendship, as your lords have done.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: First Serving-man Content: I'll to the surgeon's.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Second Serving-man And so will I.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Third Serving-man And I will see what physic the tavern affords.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exeunt Serving-men, Mayor,  and c

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Accept this scroll, most gracious sovereign,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Which in the right of Richard Plantagenet

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: We do exhibit to your majesty.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well urged, my Lord of Warwick: or sweet prince,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And if your grace mark every circumstance,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You have great reason to do Richard right;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Especially for those occasions

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: At Eltham Place I told your majesty.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And those occasions, uncle, were of force:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Therefore, my loving lords, our pleasure is

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That Richard be restored to his blood.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Let Richard be restored to his blood;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: So shall his father's wrongs be recompensed.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: As will the rest, so willeth Winchester.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If Richard will be true, not that alone

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But all the whole inheritance I give

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That doth belong unto the house of York,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: From whence you spring by lineal descent.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: RICHARD

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: Thy humble servant vows obedience

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: And humble service till the point of death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Stoop then and set your knee against my foot;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And, in reguerdon of that duty done,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I gird thee with the valiant sword of York:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Rise Richard, like a true Plantagenet,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And rise created princely Duke of York.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: RICHARD

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: And so thrive Richard as thy foes may fall!

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: And as my duty springs, so perish they

speaker: PLANTAGENET
text_entry: That grudge one thought against your majesty!

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Welcome, high prince, the mighty Duke of York!

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: [Aside]  Perish, base prince, ignoble Duke of York!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now will it best avail your majesty

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To cross the seas and to be crown'd in France:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: The presence of a king engenders love

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Amongst his subjects and his loyal friends,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As it disanimates his enemies.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: When Gloucester says the word, King Henry goes;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For friendly counsel cuts off many foes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Your ships already are in readiness.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but EXETER

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Ay, we may march in England or in France,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Not seeing what is likely to ensue.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: This late dissension grown betwixt the peers

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Burns under feigned ashes of forged love

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And will at last break out into a flame:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: As fester'd members rot but by degree,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Till bones and flesh and sinews fall away,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: So will this base and envious discord breed.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And now I fear that fatal prophecy

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Which in the time of Henry named the Fifth

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Was in the mouth of every sucking babe;

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: That Henry born at Monmouth should win all

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And Henry born at Windsor lose all:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Which is so plain that Exeter doth wish

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: His days may finish ere that hapless time.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Exit
